id.description: The ID of the language. Must be from 3-5 characters, and lowercase [a-z].

description.description:
A short description of the language - compare the first few paragraphs
of a Wikipedia article.

name.description: The name of the word class.

lang.description: The language the word belongs to.

abbreviation.description: The abbreviation for the word class.

created.description: When the word class was created.

updated.description: When the word class was last updated.

username.description: The username of the user, which is the primary key for finding them.

display_name.description:
The name that the user would prefer to be displayed. Can contain anything,
although it is .trim()ed. OpenAPI just does not seem to enjoy a space
here, for some reason?

profile_picture.description:
A link to the image for the profile picture of this user. By default, the
image is 400 pixels square at maximum, but can be any aspect ratio or size
within that. If the profile picture is bigger than that, it'll crop it using
sharp's cover fit resize, which, if the docs are to be believed, should
be equivalent to the CSS `object-fit: cover; object-position: center;`

banner.description:
A link to the image for the banner of this user. See the profile_picture
attribute for more info on resizing - the maximum size by default is 500px
high by 1500px wide.

created.description: The timestamp for when the user was created.

updated.description: The timestamp for when the user's information was last updated.

ownedLangs.description: The languages which this user owns.

contributedLangs.description: The languages which this user is able to contribute to.

id.description: The ID of the language. Must be from 3-5 characters, and lowercase [a-z].

description.description:
A short description of the language - compare the first few paragraphs of
a Wikipedia article.

flag.description:
A link to the image for the flag of the language. By default, the image is
800 pixels square at maximum, but can be any size or aspect ratio. If
the flag is bigger than that, it'll crop it using sharp's cover fit resize -
which, if the docs are to be believed, should be equivalent to the CSS
`object-fit: cover; object-position: center;`

created.description: The timestamp when the language was created.

updated.description:
The timestamp when the language was last updated - this does not
include addition of words.

partsOfSpeech.description: Parts of speech for the language.

owner.description: The user who owns the language.

contributors.description: Any other users who are able to contribute to the language.

lang.description: The language this part of speech is for.

name.description: The name of this part of speech.

abbreviation.description: The abbreviation of this part of speech.

created.description: The time this part of speech was made.

updated.description: The time this part of speech was last updated.

statusCode.description: The HTTP status code of the error.

message.description: The message(s) describing the error, or just the HTTP error.
example: description must be shorter than 5000 characters

error.description: The name of the HTTP error, if `message` has more specific information.

statusCode.description: The HTTP status code of the error.

message.description: The message(s) describing the error, or just the HTTP error.

error.description: The name of the HTTP error, if `message` has more specific information.

message.description: The message(s) describing the error, or just the HTTP error.
message.example: User does not have permission to change this resource.

error.description: The name of the HTTP error, if `message` has more specific information.

message.description: The message(s) describing the error, or just the HTTP error.

error.description: The name of the HTTP error, if `message` has more specific information.

statusCode.description: The HTTP status code of the error.

message.description: The message(s) describing the error, or just the HTTP error.
message.example: No user by this username was found.

error.description: The name of the HTTP error, if `message` has more specific information.

id.description: The ID of the language. Must be from 3-5 characters, and lowercase [a-z].

description.description:
A short description of the language - compare the first few paragraphs
of a Wikipedia article.

username.description:
The username that this user should be found under. Alphanumeric, plus dash and
underscore.

password.description:
The password to use for the user. I've been informed that fifteen characters
may be a bit much, but I figure it's better to be safe than sorry. Max is 64
since bcrypt truncates anything afterward anyway.

display_name.description:
The name that the user would prefer to be displayed. If blank, defaults
to the username.

username.description:
The username that this user should be found under. Alphanumeric, plus dash and
underscore.

password.description:
The password to use for the user. I've been informed that fifteen characters
may be a bit much, but I figure it's better to be safe than sorry. Max is 64
since bcrypt truncates anything afterward anyway.

display_name.description:
The name that the user would prefer to be displayed. If blank, defaults
to the username.

id.description: ID of the session to refresh.

refreshToken.description: Refresh token from the session to refresh.

user.description: The user who is logged in through this session.

accessToken.description: The access token to use for authentication.

statusCode.description: The HTTP status code of the error.

message.description: The message(s) describing the error, or just the HTTP error.

error.description: The name of the HTTP error, if `message` has more specific information.

statusCode.description: The HTTP status code of the error.

message.description: The message(s) describing the error, or just the HTTP error.

error.description: The name of the HTTP error, if `message` has more specific information.

owner.description:
Whether the user is the owner of this language. There is always one owner
for a language - if the owner deletes their account, the language will
be deleted as well. The owner is the only user who can assign the owner
permission to anyone else, and cannot remove it from themselves. They are
also the only ones able to assign or revoke the changePermissions permission.

changePermissions.description:
Whether the user can change permissions for other contributors. They can
change the permissions for anyone other than the owner, and cannot grant
or revoke owner. One cannot edit their own permissions, however.

changeId.description: Whether the user can change the language's ID.

changeInfo.description:
Whether the user can change the language's info - word classes,
parts of speech, flag, description, and name.

changeWords.description: Whether the user can create, update, edit, or delete words for the language.

user.description: The user whose permissions are described by this permissions object.

lang.description: The language for which this permissions object applies.

owner.description:
Whether the user is the owner of this language. There is always one owner
for a language - if the owner deletes their account, the language will
be deleted as well. The owner is the only user who can assign the owner
permission to anyone else, and cannot remove it from themselves. They are
also the only ones able to assign or revoke the changePermissions permission.

changePermissions.description:
Whether the user can change permissions for other contributors. They can
change the permissions for anyone other than the owner, and cannot grant
or revoke owner. One cannot edit their own permissions, however.

changeId.description: Whether the user can change the language's ID.

changeInfo.description:
Whether the user can change the language's info - word classes,
parts of speech, flag, description, and name.

changeWords.description: Whether the user can create, update, edit, or delete words for the language.

created.description: The timestamp when the permissions were added.

updated.description: The timestamp when the permissions were last updated.

owner.description:
Whether the user is the owner of this language. There is always one owner
for a language - if the owner deletes their account, the language will
be deleted as well. The owner is the only user who can assign the owner
permission to anyone else, and cannot remove it from themselves. They are
also the only ones able to assign or revoke the changePermissions permission.

changePermissions.description:
Whether the user can change permissions for other contributors. They can
change the permissions for anyone other than the owner, and cannot grant
or revoke owner. One cannot edit their own permissions, however.

changeId.description: Whether the user can change the language's ID.

changeInfo.description:
Whether the user can change the language's info - word classes,
parts of speech, flag, description, and name.

changeWords.description: Whether the user can create, update, edit, or delete words for the language.

get.description: Finds a language by its id.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to return, up to 100. Default is 25.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The cursor from which to search. Paginated requests will return a beforeCursor and afterCursor, to allow you to move forward and backward in the pages.

get.description: Gets the flag for a language.

post.description: Adds a flag for a language.

patch.description: Updates a flag for a language.

delete.description: Removes a flag from a language.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to return, up to 100. Default is 25.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The cursor from which to search. Paginated requests will return a beforeCursor and afterCursor, to allow you to move forward and backward in the pages.

get.description: Finds a user by their username.

post.description: Sets a profile picture for a user.

requestBody.description: The profile picture to be used
The profile picture to be used

delete.description: Removes the profile picture for a user.

get.description: Gets the banner for a user.

post.description: Sets the banner for a user.

patch.description: Updates the banner for a user.

delete.description: Removes the banner for a user.

post.description: Creates a session for a user.

get.description: Gets all sessions by a user, with pagination. Note that expired sessions will not be removed - you can check the refresh JWT to see which ones are actually active.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to return, up to 100. Default is 25.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The cursor from which to search. Paginated requests will return a beforeCursor and afterCursor, to allow you to move forward and backward in the pages.

post.description: Refresh a session, getting a new access token to use.

delete.description: Delete a session. Note that if you delete a session before the refresh token is expired,the refresh token will still be valid.
Revoke all permissions from a user.

get.description: Finds all permissions for a language.
Finds all words in a language.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to return, up to 100. Default is 25.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The cursor from which to search. Paginated requests will return a beforeCursor and afterCursor, to allow you to move forward and backward in the pages.

get.description: Finds words by their orthographic representation. You should encode any value here to be value-safe; otherwise parts may be interpreted as other things than a parameter. Note thatthis will return an array, since multiple words can have thesame representation / pronunciation. Use the :word/:num endpoint to get one specific word.
Finds a word by its orthographic representation and order of addition. The index will be the same as its index in the value returned by the :word endpoint. Again, ensure this is URL-safe.
Gets all of a language's parts of speech.
Get a specific part of speech from a language.
Gets all the word classes in a language.
Gets a specific word class by its abbreviation.
